input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF SAINT-DENIS NEW COMMUNITY. Summary: Normal Maintenance Services for Pipes, Unclogging, Cleaning and Various Pumping in Municipal Buildings, the Ccas and the Mériel Holiday Center (95). Description: The duration of the framework agreement is one year from notification. It is renewable 3 times per period of one year, i.e. 4 years maximum. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MONTLUÇON COMMUNITY. Summary: Management of Sludge Produced by the Montluçon Wastewater Treatment Plant. Description: Montluçon community operates an activated sludge wastewater treatment plant, rue de la Loue in Montluçon. This station, with a capacity of 88,830 PE on an annual daily average (131,667 PE at daily peak), adds value to agriculture its entire production of compliant sludge. The contents of trace elements or compounds contained in the sludge produced are generally well below the limit values ​​appearing in the authorization order concerning the recycling of sludge. So, Montluçon Community favors agricultural development. The sludge, before being spread, is previously thickened, dehydrated, and limed. The annual tonnage of raw limed sludge to be spread is of the order of more or less 7,500 tonnes. However in 2024, the STEU produced around 1,500 tonnes of limed sludge whose PCB contents exceeded the limit values ​​(accidental pollution). As this sludge could not be used for agricultural spreading, an alternative industrial recovery had to be implemented. in place. The service will therefore include: -the loading and transport of raw limed sludge on the plots of the spreading plan, -the recovery and spreading on the plots of the spreading plan of raw limed sludge, -analytical monitoring, agronomic, administrative and logistics of sludge, Finally, to take into account possible sludge pollution, alternative recovery methods that comply with regulations will also be included. Access.... Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Management of Sludge Produced by the Montluçon Wastewater Treatment Plant

The contents of trace elements or compounds contained in the sludge produced are generally well below the limit values ​​appearing in the authorization order concerning the recycling of sludge. So, Montluçon Community favors agricultural development. The sludge, before being spread, is previously thickened, dehydrated, and limed. The annual tonnage of raw limed sludge to be spread is of the order of more or less 7,500 tonnes. However in 2024, the STEU produced around 1,500 tonnes of limed sludge whose PCB contents exceeded the limit values ​​(accidental pollution). As this sludge could not be used for agricultural spreading, an alternative industrial recovery had to be implemented. in place. The service will therefore include: -the loading and transport of raw limed sludge on the plots of the spreading plan, -the recovery and spreading on the plots of the spreading plan of raw limed sludge, -analytical monitoring, agronomic, administrative and logistics of sludge, Finally, to take into account possible sludge pollution, alternative recovery methods that comply with regulations will also be included. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: EDF SA. Summary: Framework Contract for the Maintenance of Source Substations and Mv/Lv Substations for Edf Martinique. Description: Framework agreement for a period of 6 years relating to the maintenance of green spaces (weeding, clearing) of buildings, and small works at Source Substations and MV/LV substations on the territory of Martinique, on behalf of EDF SEI MARTINIQUE. The market is allocated (1 lot for source substations, 1 lot for MV/LV substations) Lot 1: Maintenance of MV/LV substations for EDF SEI Martinique This lot includes the maintenance and cleaning of the various HTA/LV distribution stations of EDF MARTINIQUE, and includes switching cabinets (for example AC3M, AC3T, HTA/BT etc). Services include cleaning of premises, and maintenance of access to stations by weeding and clearing (maintenance of green spaces) Lot 2: Maintenance of Posts Source for EDF SEI Martinique This lot includes the maintenance and cleaning of the various Source stations of EDF MARTINIQUE. Services include: Cleaning of premises, Maintenance of green spaces by weeding or manual uprooting, brush clearing and tree pruning, and finally fence maintenance. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CNES SIDE OF GRAND PIC ST LOUP. Summary: Collection Service for Voluntary Contribution Columns for Glass 2026. Description: Its purpose is the collection of raw household cullet in columns from voluntary contributions (4 m3 columns all equipped with a simple rotating hook grip opening by feeler or drop side or rotating and provided with an automatic closure). In view of the economic context of the historic site of the Languedoc glassworks processing center in Vergèze (30310), the community is proposing a BPU with 3 possible sites for the deposit of glass: -The deposit of glass collected from the Languedoc glassworks in Vergèze. -Depositing the glass collected on the load break platform located near Vauvert with the candidate being required to be affiliated with OI Manufacturing. -Depositing the glass collected at the OI glassworks in Béziers.. Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MIXED HOUSEHOLD WASTE PROCESSING UNION OF NORTHERN SEINE-ET-MARNE. Summary: Awareness and Engaging Communication Program, Based on a Territorial Diagnosis, Aiming to Improve the Sorting Performance of Individual Housing in the Four Adhered Territories.... Description: AWARENESS AND ENGAGING COMMUNICATION PROGRAM, BASED ON A TERRITORIAL DIAGNOSIS, AIMING TO IMPROVE THE SORTING PERFORMANCE OF INDIVIDUAL HOUSING IN THE FOUR ADHERED TERRITORIES... This public contract is a continuation of the 2024 Call for Collection Projects, led by Citeo and Adelphe, for which SMITOM du Nord Seine-et-Marne and its members were the winners. This call for projects aims to optimize the selective collection of household packaging and graphic papers, by improving the quality of the sorting process and reducing the refusal rate at sorting centers. The actions planned in this framework, focusing primarily on dense collective housing sectors, a large part of the SMITOM territory - made up of areas predominantly individual and low-density suburban housing - remains uncovered. The purpose of this market is to complete the action program initially planned by specifically targeting suburban housing. It aims to set up a system diagnosis, communication and awareness-raising, consistent with the lessons and tools developed within the framework of the AAP Collection, but adapted to the specificities of individual housing. Like AAP Collecte, this market targeting housing suburban housing is part of the specific objective OS 2.6 Promote the transition towards a circular economy of the Île-de-France and Seine Basin Regional Program. It provides in particular: •A field behavioral diagnosis, carried out with a representative sample of suburban households, in order to measure actual sorting practices, identify the most frequent errors and.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RATP. Summary: Republic Station Rehabilitation Projectlot: Supply, Installation and Maintenance of 3 Life Bases and Site Installations. Description: As part of the rehabilitation and desaturation work at République station. République station is located on the edge of the 3rd, 10th and 11th arrondissement of Paris and distributes 5 metro lines: L3/L5/L8/L9/L11 for a total surface area of approximately 14,000 m². The work consists of waterproofing almost all of the spaces, redeveloping the entire station, restoring smooth flow and desaturating the spaces while improving the passenger journey. The project will also allow upgrading the station in terms of fire safety, accessibility and security. The purpose of this contract is the installation, supply, development, maintenance and removal work of the 3 life bases located near the Place de la République in Paris for the station rehabilitation operation, on locations authorized by the city, in the 3 districts concerned. The 3 life bases of the project are named according to their geographical area: -Life base n°1 Léon Jouhaux for companions men composed of 18 bungalows on 2 levels located rue Léon Jouhaux in the immediate vicinity of the fire station (75010) -Life base n°2 Malta for MOE/CDP offices composed of 16 bungalows on 2 levels located rue de Malte (75011) -Life base n°3 Elisabeth, for female companions and company management made up of 6 bungalows in the DRC located Passage Sainte Elisabeth (75003) The tenderer acknowledges being fully informed that the work is.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Republic Station Rehabilitation Projectlot: Supply, Installation and Maintenance of 3 Life Bases and Site Installations

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: S3T'EC. Summary: Sorting Household Waste and Recycling from S3T'Ec. Description: The contract is a multi-awardee framework agreement with purchase orders aimed at sorting recyclable household waste from S3T-ec. Sorting recyclable household waste • Reception and sorting of recyclable household waste from S3T-ec; • THE conditioning of recyclable materials resulting from sorting with a view to their recovery; • Characterization of incoming flows as well as sorting refusals; • Organizing visits to the sorting center; • Administrative management (including weighing) of different flows received, sorted and evacuated, as well as reporting to S3T-ec; • Transport and processing of sorting refusals until the commissioning of the S3T-ec UVE; • Reception and sorting of recyclable household waste from S3T-ec collected in multimaterials. Doc Title: Sorting household waste and recycling from S3T'ec Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SMO PROCESSING HOUSEHOLD WASTE. Summary: Awareness and Engaging Communication Program, Based on a Territorial Diagnosis, Aiming to Improve the Sorting Performance of Individual Housing in the Smitom Nord Territory 77. Description: This public market is a continuation of the 2024 Call for Collection Projects, led by Citeo and Adelphe, for which SMITOM du Nord Seine-et-Marne and its members were the winners. This call for projects aims to optimize the collection selection of household packaging and graphic papers, by improving the quality of the sorting process and reducing the refusal rate at sorting centers. The actions planned in this framework, focusing primarily on dense collective housing sectors, a large part of the SMITOM territory - made up of predominantly individual and low-density residential areas - remains uncovered. The purpose of this contract is to complete the action program initially planned by specifically targeting suburban housing. It aims to set up a diagnostic, communication and awareness system, consistent with the lessons and tools developed within the framework of the AAP Collection, but adapted to the specificities of the habitat individual. Like the AAP Collecte, this market targeting suburban housing is part of the specific objective OS 2.6 Promoting the transition to a circular economy of the Île-de-France and Seine Basin Regional Program. He plans in particular: • A field behavioral diagnosis, carried out with a representative sample of suburban households, in order to measure actual sorting practices, identify the most frequent errors and.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The actions planned in this framework, focusing primarily on dense collective housing sectors, a large part of the SMITOM territory - made up of predominantly individual and low-density residential areas - remains uncovered. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: FRENCH BIODIVERSITY OFFICE. Summary: Fight against Predation by Rats and American Minks on Island Marine Bird Colonies as Part of Life Mobile Marine Species. Description: The purpose of this contract is to carry out feasibility studies and the sizing of operations for the eradication of the Norway rat (Rattus norvegicus) and/or the black rat (Rattus rattus) when present, to implement the operation eradication and ensure the sustainability of the action by implementing monitoring and biosecurity measures adapted to the proposed sites. It will also include the detection and fight against the American mink (Neogale vison), an exotic species. invasive species whose predation also constitutes a major threat to colonies of nesting seabirds, with the carrying out of a study of presence and feasibility of control, the implementation of a control operation adapted to the species, then the sustainability of the action thanks to monitoring and biosecurity measures specific to the sites concerned.. Description: The metropolis of Lyon is responsible for the collection and processing of household waste and similar waste (article L5215-20 of the general code of local authorities) in the 58 municipalities in its territory, representing a population of 1,424,069 inhabitants (source Insee 01/01/2024). As such, it carries out door-to-door or voluntary collection of household waste, separate collection of dry recyclables (paper and packaging), glass and bio-waste. It provides its residents a network of 19 recycling centers to collect waste not covered by traditional collection systems. Additional services closest to the resident are also set up such as waste drop-off points. green or on-call home collections of bulky waste and WEEE or exceptionally mobile recycling centers. As part of this consultation, the Métropole de Lyon is awarding 3 lots for the purpose of taking charge and operating the equipment collection of occasional waste including: - the operation of eighteen public recycling centers (geographical allotment) and 19 recycling centers from October 2028 - the collection of green waste at voluntary drop-off points during the autumn and spring, - additional services including mobile recycling centers or temporary recycling centers. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SEWING SAW (EPTB LIGHT). Summary: Environmental and Socio-Economic Study for the Definition of a Flood Hazard Management Strategy in the Lys Watershed. Description: This study brings together action sheets 1.01, 1.02, 6.01 and 6.02 of the PEP. Its objective is to prepare the hazard management aspect of the future PAPI 4. It will mainly consist of: - Take stock of the storage volume available in the basin slope of the Lys; -Determine the initial state of the environment; -Analyze certain projects currently being defined; -Provide proposals for Nature-Based Solutions (NFS) to help reduce the risk of flooding ; -Propose an optimization of the management method for structures in flood; -Carry out the multi-criteria analysis and environmental assessment of the developed program. Two principles should guide the service provider in carrying out the study: -Take into account the effects of the proposed developments both as a tool for reducing hazards on a local scale and as a large-scale tool for reducing contributions to the large-scale canal; -Comply with the spirit of the multi-criteria analysis approach and environmental assessment and as such have an iterative approach to its definition of projects. The action program studied by the office must be part of the adaptation strategy to climate change in the Lys basin. As such, the Proposals must be designed to respond to the challenges of the current climate as well as those of the prospects for climate change. hydrological development strategy for the Lys watershed It concerns the development of.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: EDF SA. Summary: Framework Contract for the Maintenance of Source Substations and Mv/Lv Substations for Edf Martinique. Description: Framework agreement for a period of 6 years relating to the maintenance of green spaces (weeding, brush cutting), cleaning and 3D (rat control, disinfestation, disinfection) of buildings, and small works at Source Posts and posts HTA/BT in the territory of Martinique, on behalf of EDF SEI MARTINIQUE. The market is allocated (1 lot for source substations, 1 lot for MV/LV substations) Lot 1: Maintenance of MV/LV substations for EDF SEI Martinique This lot includes maintenance and cleaning of the various HTA/LV distribution stations of EDF MARTINIQUE, and includes the switching cabinets (for example AC3M, AC3T, HTA/BT etc). The services include cleaning of premises (including rodent control, disinfestation and disinfection of the sites concerned), and the maintenance of access to the stations by weeding and clearing (maintenance of green spaces) Lot 2: Maintenance of Source Substations for EDF SEI Martinique This lot includes the maintenance and cleaning of the various stations Source from EDF MARTINIQUE. Services include: Cleaning of premises including pest control inside and around the building, pest control and disinfection of the sites concerned, Maintenance of green spaces by weeding or uprooting manual, clearing and pruning of trees, and finally the maintenance of fences. Doc Title: Framework contract for the maintenance of source substations and MV/LV substations for EDF MARTINIQUE Contract Type: service.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2025-12-22. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RESPONSIBLE PURCHASING SERVICE. Summary: Treatment of Treated and Untreated Wood Waste from Recycling Centers in the West Sector.. Description: The purpose of this market is the treatment of wood having undergone a treatment operation, deposited by the initial producer of wood type B waste only in the West sector. The urban community has an outlet for wood treatment untreated branches type, but for various reasons, it is possible that this orientation of this type of materials is not possible. This is why the present consultation proposes the possibility of also being able to treat these types of wood. For reasons of understanding, the name wood in this document and the additional documents concerns treated and untreated wood waste. This contract does not include transportation. The service provider will propose a treatment cost to the ton, a purchase price can be proposed to the community, it will be mentioned in the BPU and in the DQE. This contract passed through an open call for tenders follows the declaration of contract no. 22S67A without follow-up and was also the subject of authorization from launch approved in community office on 08/12/2025.. Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: HAUTS-DE-SEINE DEPARTMENT. Summary: Cleaning Services for Public College Premises in the Hauts-De-Seine Department. Description: The contract covers cleaning services for public college premises in the Hauts-de-Seine Department. The purpose of the services to be carried out is to maintain the equipment, premises and sanitary facilities in good clean conditions, hygiene and comfort for college students and staff according to intervention intervals adapted to the nature of the supports to be maintained, their condition and their use. The objective is therefore to guarantee a level of cleanliness, hygiene and comfort in accordance with the requirements of the Hauts-de-Seine Department. Services include: - Cleaning of premises; - Cleaning glass surfaces accessible on the same level; - The supply of equipment, products and consumables; - Disposal of waste to containers in accordance with sorting requirements. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AUVERGNE RHONE ALPES REGION. Summary: Environmental Project Management Assistance - Design and Construction of the Veloroute Via Maurienne. Description: The incumbent provides Project Management Assistance (AMO) in the field of the environment as part of the Via Maurienne cycle development project.<br> The holder supports the Project Owner on the environmental part, particularly for the drafting of the various protocols and contracts, to monitoring and controls in the upstream/work phase both on the project trace and on compensatory measures.<br> The Via Maurienne project includes a few points of attention, particularly relating to the environment (Natura 2000 zone, wetlands, waterways, etc.) and legal matters (authorization environmental protection under investigation, declaration of public utility, etc.).<br> Single lot - AMO Environnement for the Via Maurienne cycle route project<br> Assistance to environmental project management as part of the design and implementation phases of the Via Maurienne cycle route project<br> Document Title: Environmental Project Management Assistance - Design and Construction of the Veloroute via Maurienne<br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: BORDEAUX METROPOLE. Summary: Modernization and Maintenance of the Weighing Device of the Waste Transfer Centers of the Waste Prevention and Management Department of Bordeaux Metropole. Description: The framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. Services are regulated by unit prices. The estimated amounts are indicative and include all renewal periods. To guarantee the coherence and effectiveness of the project, it is essential to entrust all services to a single holder. The modernization of a weighing device indeed constitutes an inseparable whole including: - The supply and equipment of the device - The weighing management software suite. The interdependence of these elements therefore requires an approach global to ensure the homogeneity of the system, the compatibility of equipment and optimized implementation. Published Date: 2025-12-08. Closing Date: 2025-12-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Hydrocleaning Services, Occasional Television and Visual Inspections of Sanitation/Heat Networks, Discharge Stations, Wastewater Treatment Plant Works, D-.. Description: The purpose of this contract is to provide the following services: -Maintenance by hydrocleaning of all gravity and pressure sanitation networks (EU strict, EP and unitary) as well as ancillary works (sand traps, grids and drains, sumps, reservoirs buried storms, siphons, etc.), -Maintenance by pumping and cleaning of all discharge/lift stations (PR) to ensure their proper functioning, -Maintenance by pumping and cleaning of all the works of the treatment plants for which the public entity is responsible for operation, -The establishment of an on-call service dedicated to the market, 24 hours a day, 365 days a year which meets the requirements set out in this CCTP. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SIOM OF THE CHEVREUSE VALLEY. Summary: Sorting of Household and Similar Waste in the Territory of the Siom of the Chevreuse Valley. Description: The purpose of the contract is the sorting of packaging and paper-newspaper-magazines, including the storage and loading of materials resulting from the sorting of household and similar waste from the territory of the SIOM of the Vallee de Chevreuse. The contract is a non-allotted framework agreement with purchase orders in application of article R2362-8 of the public procurement code. The minimum and maximum are expressed in tonnes to be sorted, as follows: - Minimum annual tonnage: 9,000 tonnes to sort - Maximum annual tonnage: 14,000 tonnes to sort The contract is concluded for a period of one year from March 1, 2026, it is tacitly renewable 3 times 1 year within the limit of 4 years, i.e. until February 28, 2030, the holder cannot refuse the renewal. The contractor takes advantage of the period between notification of the contract and the start date of performance of the services to take measures preparatory work for the execution of the contract, in order to be operational on March 1, 2026. The candidate must therefore be able, from March 1, 2026, to carry out the missions mentioned above for the entire supply of packaging and paper household.. Published Date: 2025-12-08. Closing Date: 2026-01-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Sorting of Household and Similar Waste in the Territory of the Siom of the Chevreuse Valley
output.Description: The purpose of the contract is the sorting of packaging and paper-newspaper-magazines, including the storage and loading of materials resulting from the sorting of household and similar waste from the territory of the SIOM of the Vallee de Chevreuse. The contract is a non-allotted framework agreement with purchase orders in application of article R2362-8 of the public procurement code. The minimum and maximum are expressed in tonnes to be sorted, as follows: - Minimum annual tonnage: 9,000 tonnes to sort - Maximum annual tonnage: 14,000 tonnes to sort The contract is concluded for a period of one year from March 1, 2026, it is tacitly renewable 3 times 1 year within the limit of 4 years, i.e. until February 28, 2030, the holder cannot refuse the renewal. The contractor takes advantage of the period between notification of the contract and the start date of performance of the services to take measures preparatory work for the execution of the contract, in order to be operational on March 1, 2026. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF COMMUNITIES OF PUISAYE-FORTERRE. Summary: Household and Similar Waste Collection Market. Description: The purpose of this contract is to provide the collection service for household and similar waste in the territory of the Puisaye-Forterre community of communes, according to the list of sectors provided to the CCTP. The service consists of ensuring the collection: • Door to door, household waste 1 times per fortnight in all municipalities in the territory, except for frequency exceptions listed in the CCTP. • Door to door, recyclable waste once a fortnight in all municipalities in the territory except for frequency exceptions listed in the CCTP. • Door to door, bio-waste 1 time per week in all municipalities in the territory except for frequency exceptions listed in the CCTP. • In Voluntary Delivery Points (PAV) in aerial and semi-buried glass columns. For large producers or producers with specific activities, the community has determined a list of points subject to specific services (frequencies = C1 or C2, or others). This list appears in the annex to the CCTP. The Holder must in particular carry out its services with: • The obligation to implement the human and material resources necessary to respect the defined objectives for this present market, • Concern for the quality of the service provided to users, • Respect for deadlines for transmitting information and the quality/reliability of the information. The services concerned by the consultation fall under category no. 16 of Annex 2A to the European directive 2004.... Published Date: 2025-12-05. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AGGLOMERATION COMMUNITY OF THE BOURG EN BRESSE BASIN. Summary: Maintenance and Cleaning Services for the Premises of the New Headquarters of the Urban Community of the Bourg-En-Bresse Basin. Description: Form of contract: framework agreement with purchase orders with minimum and maximum. Amounts for the initial period: minimum 65,000 euros excluding tax and maximum 90,000 euros excluding tax. The amounts will be identical for the renewal period. Services are regulated by unit prices. Overall deadline payment of benefits within 30 days. Prices are subject to review quarterly. No financial guarantee clause provided. 10% advance provided in the conditions of the contract. Financing: CA3B budget, financing of social clause facilitator positions by the FSE. The contracting authority does not wish to impose any form of grouping on the successful bidder. In the event of a joint group, the representative of the group is joint and several. Candidates can submit an offer, either as an individual candidate or as a member of one or more groups. The same candidate can be in several groups but cannot be a representative of more than one group. Published Date: 2025-12-05. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TROYES CHAMPAGNE METROPOLE. Summary: Door-To-Door Collection of Household Waste, Sorting and Green Waste from Troyes Champagne Metropole Lot N3: Collection in the Est Sector.. Description: The purpose of this contract is the door-to-door collection of household and similar waste (OMR, sorting and green waste) from the EST sector of Troyes Champagne Metropole.<br> In application of Article L2113-10 Public Procurement Code, this consultation is allocated as follows:<br> Lot n1: Collection North sector (M2023-043)<br> Lot n2: South sector collection (M2022-057)<br> Lot n3: EST sector collection<br> Lot n4: WEST sector collection (M2022-066)<br> Lot n5: BMA sector collection (M2024-052)<br> Lots No. 1,2, 4 and 5 have already been the subject of of a consultation and have already been assigned. Their renewal will be the subject of a separate and specific consultation.<br> This public service contract will be concluded in the form of an ordinary contract and will be treated at a global and fixed price in accordance with article D1 of the AE.<br> The validity period of the contract runs from market notification until April 30, 2032.<br> The execution of this contract will begin from the notification regarding the resumption of personnel as well as the transfer of container identification data (article V.1 of the CCTP) and from May 2, 2026 regarding pure collection services.<br> Execution deadlines are set within the CCTP.<br> Doc Title: DOOR-TO-DOOR COLLECTION OF HOUSEHOLD WASTE, SORTING AND GREEN WASTE FROM TROYES CHAMPAGNE METROPOLE Lot n3: Collection EST sector.<br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-03. Closing Date: 2026-01-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: METROPOLE NICE COTE D'AZUR. Summary: 25N0551. Operation and Cleaning of the Sanitation Works of Tramway Line 2 - Relaunch of 24N0850. Description: The purpose of the consultation is: The services concern the maintenance of equipment for the drainage of the surface or upper water table, manholes and draining pipes, wells and siphons necessary for the operation of the hydraulic transparency of the T2 tramway line. The objective is to maintain the proper functioning of the system with maintenance and cleaning of the siphon pipes, wells and water table drainage system and the dam effect, and to have a verification of the condition of the structures. This maintenance of civil engineering of underground infrastructure works transport includes: - the underground section of the covered trench of SEGURANE_CASSINI (SC), - the JEAN MEDECIN station (JM), - the ALSACE LORRAINE (AL), DURANDY (D) and GARIBALDI stations. These services consist of preventive maintenance (normally biennial) and maintenance curative (on order from the project owner depending on the condition of the works). This consultation is launched following the procedure: Open call for tenders - articles R.2124-2 1 and R.2161-2 to 5 of the Order Code public;. Published Date: 2025-12-01. Closing Date: 2026-01-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: The Lyon Metropolis manages 3,400 km of sanitation network, including 2,700 km of non-visitable networks (diameter between 100 and 1200 mm). The operations department of the Water Cycle Department carries out televised inspections (ITV) of the non-visitable sanitation networks for which it is responsible. management, throughout the territory of the Lyon Metropolis. The objective is to ensure the annual monitoring of 130 kilometers of network (including 50 km carried out internally with its own equipment) with the remainder entrusted to a specialized company (subject of this contract). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF COMMUNES LES PORTES DE L'ILE-DE-FRANCE. Summary: Framework Service Agreement with Purchase Orders for the Transport and Loading of Skips and Waste from the Recycling Center and the Green Waste Deposit Platform (2 Lots) for the Ccpif. Description: This public contract relates to the provision of skip collection services from the Community of Municipalities recycling center as well as the loading of certain waste (rubble, green waste).<br> This contract is awarded following an open tender procedure in accordance with articles L2124-2, R2161-2, R2161-3, R2161-4 and R2161-5 of the Public Procurement Code.<br> This is a single-award framework agreement for services executed by issuing purchase orders concluded with no minimum amount but with a maximum annual amount of 200,000 euro(s) excluding tax.<br> The framework agreement takes effect from February 1, 2026 or the date of its notification if this is later, for a period of one (1) year renewable three (3) times. Each renewal runs for a period of one (1) year; i.e. a maximum duration of four (4) years.<br> Technical specifications and details of services to be carried out are described in the Specifications of Special Technical Clauses (CCTP)<br> Transport and loading of skips and waste from the Freneuse recycling center<br> Transport and loading of green waste from the CCPIF to the Neauphlette deposit platform and the Freneuse recycling center<br> Document Title: Framework service agreement with purchase orders for the transport and loading of skips and waste from the recycling center and the green waste deposit platform (2 lots) for the CCPIF<br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-11-25. Closing Date: 2025-12-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF JOINVILLE-LE-PONT. Summary: Cleaning and Maintenance of Municipal Buildings and Ccas. Description: The purpose of the contract is to provide cleaning and maintenance services for premises and glazing in municipal and CCAS buildings. These buildings are assigned to administrative and/or technical services, early childhood or education, whether open to the public or not. The deal will be concluded for a period of one year renewable three times one year tacitly (i.e. 4 years maximum). The services include both routine maintenance (partly fixed price) and specific and one-off cleaning work (partly through purchase orders with a maximum of 288,000 Euros excluding tax for the City and 72,000 Euros excluding tax for the CCAS over the total duration of the market). The specific technical clauses (CCTP) specifies the description of the expected services. The commune of Joinville-le-Pont and the Municipal Social Action Center of Joinville-le-Pont have formed a group of orders with a view to concluding this contract. To do this, the Municipality of Joinville-le-Pont was designated as coordinator of the group and received the mandate for the handover and signing of the walk.. Published Date: 2025-11-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Cleaning and Maintenance of Municipal Buildings and Ccas
output.Description: The purpose of the contract is to provide cleaning and maintenance services for premises and glazing in municipal and CCAS buildings. These buildings are assigned to administrative and/or technical services, early childhood or education, whether open to the public or not. The deal will be concluded for a period of one year renewable three times one year tacitly (i.e. 4 years maximum). The services include both routine maintenance (partly fixed price) and specific and one-off cleaning work (partly through purchase orders with a maximum of 288,000 Euros excluding tax for the City and 72,000 Euros excluding tax for the CCAS over the total duration of the market). The specific technical clauses (CCTP) specifies the description of the expected services. The commune of Joinville-le-Pont and the Municipal Social Action Center of Joinville-le-Pont have formed a group of orders with a view to concluding this contract. To do this, the Municipality of Joinville-le-Pont was designated as coordinator of the group and received the mandate for the handover and signing of the walk.

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF COMMUNITIES LES PORTES DE L'ILE-DE-FRANCE. Summary: Framework Service Agreement with Purchase Orders for the Transport and Loading of Skips and Waste from the Recycling Center and the Green Waste Deposit Platform (2 Lots) for the Ccpif. Description: This public contract relates to the provision of skip collection services from the Community of Municipalities recycling center as well as the loading of certain waste (rubble, green waste). This contract is awarded following an open tender procedure in accordance with articles L2124-2, R2161-2, R2161-3, R2161-4 and R2161-5 of the Public Procurement Code. This is a single-award framework agreement for services executed by issuing purchase orders concluded with no minimum amount but with a maximum annual amount of 200,000 euro(s) excluding tax. The framework agreement takes effect from February 1, 2026 or the date of its notification if this is later, for a period of one (1) year renewable three (3) times. Each renewal runs for a period of one (1) year; i.e. a maximum duration of four (4) years. Technical specifications and details of services to be carried out are described in the Specifications of Special Technical Clauses (CCTP). Published Date: 2025-11-24. Closing Date: 2025-12-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Integrated Hydraulic Study of the Adour Estuary: Convergence of Maritime, Fluvial and Pluvial Dynamics in a Context of Climate Change. Description: Climate change and rising sea levels are increasing the risk of flooding in the Adour estuary, already affected by several recent floods. Existing systems provide local responses but remain partial and do not cover all maritime dynamics, fluvial and pluvial. A working group led by the CAPB, with the support of CEREMA and funding from the Green Fund, decided to launch an integrated hydraulic study. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GRAY DU CAVO. Summary: Concession for the Public Collective Sanitation Service of Sivom Du Cavo. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to designate the future concessionaire of the public collective sanitation service of SIVOM of CAVO from January 1, 2027. This procedure is carried out in application of the provisions of the 3rd part of the Public Order Code relating to concession contracts and articles L1411-1 et seq. and R1411-1 et seq. of the General Code of Territorial Authorities. The procedure will be carried out in compliance with the rules applicable to contracts relating to 2 a) of article R3126-1 of the Public Procurement Code. There procedure is open. Candidates are informed that they will have to submit their application files and their offers simultaneously. The application and offer files must be sent in compliance with the requests made in the consultation regulations. The concession contract will have for subject to the management of the public service of collective sanitation of SIVOM of CAVO. Service management concerns in particular the operation of wastewater treatment and collection works, the renewal of equipment, invoicing and the management of relations with users. The duration of the contract is 6 years. The sites are spread across the departments of Finistere and Morbihan and divided into five (5) geographical zones in Brest and surrounding areas, Saint Servais, Landivisiau, Crozon peninsula, and Lorient. The technical characteristics are specified in the CCTP of DAF_2024_000953. The contract comprises two (2) lots distributed as follows: lot 1: management of non-hazardous waste and collection areas; the estimated annual amount is 1,510,000.00 euros excluding tax. lot 2: management of hazardous waste; The estimated annual amount is 420,000.00 euros excluding tax. The contract is concluded with a minimum and a maximum in quantities of waste treated over the total duration (R. 21624 of the CCP). Minimum quantities and maximum quantities of waste processed over the total duration of the contract are: Lot No. 1: minimum quantities: 11,000 tonnes maximum quantities: 39,000 tonnes Lot No. 2: minimum quantities: 1,560 tonnes maximum quantities: 5,500 tons. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ARTE G.E.I.E.. Summary: Maintenance and Disinfection of Premises and Maintenance of the Glazing, the Square and the Terrace of the Arte Geie Company Restaurant. The coordinator of this group of orders is the Plaine Commune Public Territorial Establishment, represented by its President. The services are divided into 7 lots. Each lot will be the subject of a separate market. The order group coordinator is responsible for signing and notifying the contracts. For lots 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, the coordinator is in charge of executing the public contract. For lot 5, the Coordinator is not in responsible for executing the public contract. Indeed, the member concerned by this lot will be individually responsible for carrying out the services for their own needs. Also, the City of Ile-Saint-Denis will ensure the execution of its market, as far as it is concerned.<br> Pest control operations by natural predation of outdoor spaces on the territory of the EPT Plaine Commune<br> All members of the order group are affected by this lot.<br> Diagnostic...

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SAINT-MAURICE TOWN HALL - MUNICIPALITY OF SAINT-MAURICE. Summary: Maintenance of Sanitation Networks and Equipment in Municipal Buildings. Description: The purpose of the contract is the preventive and curative maintenance of the sanitation networks of municipal facilities in the town of Saint-Maurice. The contract is concluded at mixed prices. All scheduled preventive maintenance services are remunerated by application of a global and fixed price. Additional preventive maintenance interventions and curative maintenance interventions, paid for by application of unit prices, appear in the Unit Price Schedule (BPU). These services will give rise to the establishment of a framework agreement concluded without a minimum annual amount and with a maximum annual amount: 40,000 euros excluding VAT or 160,000 euros excluding VAT overall. The service contract is concluded for an initial period of 12 months and is tacitly renewable 3 times without its maximum duration exceeding 4 years.. Published Date: 2025-11-08. Closing Date: 2025-12-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
